div.style: position: absolute; left:21px; top:2463px; width:902px; height:10px;
div.span: Western Reserve Schools are located in a rural community in northeast Ohio, in Mahoning County, about 20 miles west of Youngstown. The School district is located in two
townships, and houses approximately 850 students. The administration, teachers and staff attempt to offer a progressive, developmentally based curriculum for all grades.

span.span: The Western Reserve School District exhibits a great deal of pride from its history and long-standing traditions as it moves through the present and into the future.

div.style: position: absolute; left:31px; top:878px; width:590px; height:10px;

span.span: Regular Meeting of the Board of the Western Reserve Local School District

div.span: Pursuant to Senate Bill 197, that was passed by the Ohio legislature and signed by Governor DeWine,
Boards of Education are permitted to conduct board meetings electronically. As a result, the School

span.span: Board of the Western Reserve Local Schools will conduct its regular meeting of the Board on
electronically. The meeting will not be held at Western Reserve Local Schools, which

div.span: is the usual regular meeting site. The new location of the electronic meeting can be accessed at:
Zoom link:
Meeting ID: 518 818 7689
Password: 8ybTQ2

span.span: Western Reserve Local School District 2020-2021 New Student Open Enrollment

div.span: The Western Reserve Local School District is continuing with Open Enrollment for the 2020-2021 School
Year for grades K-10. Based on classroom size certain grades may be waitlisted.
Please go under Forms and Policy > New Student Open Enrollment to apply.

span.span: Applications must be submitted by May 26,2020.

div.span: if you have any questions please email Stephanie Fabian at sfabian@wrls.k12.oh.us

span.span: Please return any library book you may have. There will be a large bin

div.span: placed in the Elementary Alcove Entrance (outside). Place the book inside the bin. This will be greatly
appreciated.

span.span: until further notice and for any questions to please email

div.span: Stephanie Fabian - sfabian@wrls.k12.oh.us
Western Reserve Local Schools Counseling Services K-12 (during Coronavirus school closure)
Office Hours
BY APPOINTMENT ONLY- via ZOOM or Phone
Please email Mrs. Matos to schedule.
Mrs. Matos can be reached by email (dmatos@wrls.k12.oh.us) or by leaving a message at (330) 547-
0818 in the event that you have questions, concerns, or would like to set up an individual ZOOM or
Phone appointment.

Brian Sunderman passed away suddenly on December 1st. Brian and his wife Melissa and their
children all graduated from Western Reserve and have been life long residents of the reserve
community. Lets show our support to help them through this difficult time. Contact: Tina Vancise @

img.alt: Mahoning County Educational Service Center STUDENTS

div.style: position: absolute; left:651px; top:1002px; width:288px; height:10px;
div.span: The Western Reserve Local School District is aligned with the Mahoning
County Educational Service Center (MCESC) Business Advisory

span.span: The MCESC Business Advisory Council is focused on educating

div.span: Mahoning Valley students, parents and educators about the wide range
of career opportunities available, making connections with resources to

span.span: pursue a pathway and providing support to ensure success.

div.span: A well-prepared workforce that contributes to the economic development
and improved quality of life throughout the Mahoning Valley region.
To advise, support and empower Mahoning Valley educators in
delivering the instruction and experiences students need to develop
relevant, in-demand employment skills as part of their academic and
technical preparation for college, careers and/or military service.

span.span: Regular Meeting of the Board of the Western Reserve Local School

div.span: District
Pursuant to Senate Bill 197, that was passed by the Ohio legislature and
signed by Governor DeWine, Boards of Education are permitted to conduct
board meetings electronically. As a result, the School Board of the Western

span.span: Reserve Local Schools will conduct its regular meeting of the Board on
electronically. The meeting will not be held at

div.span: Western Reserve Local Schools, which is the usual regular meeting site. The
new location of the electronic meeting can be accessed at:
Zoom link:
Meeting ID: 518 818 7689
Password: 8ybTQ2

span.span: Western Reserve Local School District 2020-2021 New Student Open

div.span: The Western Reserve Local School District is continuing with Open Enrollment
for the 2020-2021 School Year for grades K-10. Based on classroom size
certain grades may be waitlisted.
Please go under Forms and Policy > New Student Open Enrollment to
apply.

span.span: Applications must be submitted by May 26,2020.

div.span: if you have any questions please email Stephanie Fabian at

span.span: Please return any library book you may have.

div.span: There will be a large bin placed in the Elementary Alcove Entrance (outside).
Place the book inside the bin. This will be greatly appreciated.

span.span: until further notice and for any

div.span: questions to please email Stephanie Fabian - sfabian@wrls.k12.oh.us

div.span: Â© 2020 WR Online. All Rights Reserved

img.alt: Kids Eat Free This Summer Click here for more information

Western Reserve Schools are located in a rural community in northeast Ohio, in Mahoning County, about 20 miles west of Youngstown. The School district is located in two townships, and houses approximately 850 students. The administration, teachers and staff attempt to offer a progressive, developmentally based curriculum for all grades. The Western Reserve School District exhibits a great deal of pride from its history and long-standing traditions as it moves through the present and into the future.

span.span: making connections with resources to pursue a pathway and providing support to ensure success.

div.span: A well-prepared workforce that contributes to the economic development and improved quality of life
throughout the Mahoning Valley region.
To advise, support and empower Mahoning Valley educators in delivering the instruction and experiences
students need to develop relevant, in-demand employment skills as part of their academic and technical
preparation for college, careers and/or military service.
